intro: Cerinthe gymnandra var. macrosiphonia, commonly known as the giant horned poppy, is a striking member of the Papaveraceae family. It is characterized by its large, showy flowers with prominent, horn-like sepals that give it its common name. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in dry, sunny environments. Its leaves are palmately lobed and often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. This variety is prized for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in gardens for its bold, colorful blooms.
